I remember that from the Polish high school. We ware talking about the plate tectonics. The Avalonia or West European plate, was splitted and its fragment remains in America. Appalachian mountains ware an example of the same process happening in Poland, but much slower, so we have only gentle hills of the Holy Cross mountains, rejuvenated a simmilar way on the other side of this ancient plate residue (Alpine orogeny had also something with it).
I remember that perfectly, so the information that Warsaw was an ocean away was very important for the class, so we hate the Legia Warszawa football team here in Lodz 😉 (only 120 km ~90 miles away).
